summary: The 'Retired Law Enforcement Officers Continuing Service Act' proposes a grant program to assist law enforcement agencies. The Attorney General can award grants to eligible entities (state, local, Tribal, or territorial agencies) to hire retired law enforcement personnel. These personnel would train civilian employees and perform civilian law enforcement tasks. The bill includes definitions for eligible tasks, definitions, and sets up accountability measures including audits by the Inspector General, mandatory exclusions for unresolved audit findings, and a priority for entities without prior audit issues. It also mandates annual certifications and prevents duplicative grants.
